oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1860 foot officer's sword
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This foot officer's sword was manufactured by Ames. Family legend states that the sword originally belonged to John Hunt Morgan and was taken when he was killed. The sword most likely belonged to a captain and not Morgan. It's a decorative sword; most officers preferred the more substantial 1850 pattern. The family was from Steel's Creek, Sullivan County, Tennessee.
